Title: Gauss' Law for Gravity
Interpretation: The left hand side of the equation is the gravitational flux. The gravitational flux through a closed surface is proportional to the mass enclosed by the surface.

Identifiers.Definition: is the normal to an infinitesimal area on the surface being integrated over
is the total mass enclosed by the surface $S$

Title: Newton's Law of Gravitation
Interpretation: Every point mass is attracted to every single other point mass by a force pointing along a line intersecting both points. The force is proportional to the product of the two masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between them.

Identifiers.Definition: is the force between the two masses
is the mass of the first object
is the mass of the second object
is the distance between the two objects
